meanings.definition: To make a harsh, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The birds were scraiching loudly in the trees.
meanings.sent2: I heard a cat scraiching outside my window last night.
meanings.sent3: The scraiching seagulls woke me up early, but at least they sounded happy.
meanings.sent4: The scraiching wind through the branches sounded like a banshee's wail.
meanings.sent5: The scraiching brakes of the old car made me jump in surprise.

meanings.sent1: The scraiching of the chalk on the blackboard was unbearable.
meanings.sent2: The scraiching of the brakes made everyone turn their heads.
meanings.sent3: The scraiching of the rusty gate echoed through the empty field.
meanings.sent4: The scraiching of the violin cut through the silence of the concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The scraiching of the microphone feedback startled the audience.

meanings.definition: The act of making a harsh, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The scraiching of the tires on the road was deafening.
meanings.sent2: The scraiching of the seagulls filled the air with noise.
meanings.sent3: The scraiching of the children playing tag could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent4: The scraiching of the kettle signaled that the water was boiling.
meanings.sent5: The scraiching of the brakes made me flinch as the car stopped suddenly.
